generalComment.value:
"With reference to the EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 standard, the analysis describes a specific product using specific data for the processes on which the manufacturer of the specific product has an influence:
• All data related to the company's CORE activities and therefore falling within phase A3 were obtained directly from company database and are therefore to be understood as site specific;
• For UPSTREAM data, and therefore linked to phases A1 and A2 (for which the standard provides for the use of generic data), the data for as regards weight, quantity, raw materials and waste are derived either from company databases or from reworkings supplied directly by Baraclit S.p.A. and summarized in a ""Data Collection Checklist"", and therefore are to be considered site-specific. The type of material and the processes were taken from the Ecoinvent 3.8 database;
• The DOWNSTREAM data of phase A5 were processed from primary data supplied by Baraclit and are therefore to be understood specific.

Site-specific data refer to the year 2021.

As regards the quality of the electrical and thermal energy data, the company procures itself through the energy system and from the photovoltaic system located on the roof of the factory. For the portion of energy withdrawn from the grid, the Italian Residual Energy Mix 2021 (Source AIB) is considered, while for self-consumed energy from photovoltaics, the Ecoinvent dataset Electricity, low voltage {IT}| electricity production, photovoltaic, 3kWp slanted-roof installation, multi-Si, panel, mounted | Cutoff, U. Gas consumption is modeled with the dataset Heat, district or industrial, natural gas {Europe without Switzerland} | heat production, natural gas, at industrial furnace >100kW | Cutoff, U."


The allocation was made on a linear meter basis.


"For the study in question, the following were considered as cut-offs:
• The painting of the raw material ""Side casing in pre-painted sheet metal"".
Considering the % weight of this component on the total weight of each Basaltop cup, which is <1,14%, it is considered negligible the related environmental impact along the life cycle of the product."

technologicalApplicability.value:
"BasalTop® serves as the secondary connecting element between roofing tiles, designed to increase the assembly pitch and offer maximum flexibility in architectural composition.
Its structure consists of an upper plate and a lower one made of fiber-reinforced cement conglomerate. A metal armor net is placed between the two slabs, and thermal break insulation is subsequently injected using polyurethane foam.
BasalTop® features the same advanced technology as Aliant: a pre-finished monolithic structure, highly automated production entirely handled within the company, waterproofing with Baraclit ecological fiber-reinforced cement, and the ability to vary lengths and thicknesses."
 "• BasalTop® 297ST (294cm x 125cm x 10.5cm)
• BasalTop® 297SM (294cm x 125cm x 12.5cm)
• BasalTop® 297SX (294cm x 125cm x 15.0cm)
• BasalTop® 440ST (438cm x 125cm x 13.4cm)
• BasalTop® 440SM (438cm x 125cm x 14.9cm)
• BasalTop® 440SX (438cm x 125cm x 17.4cm)"
